intro: Psychotria chlorophylla, commonly known as the green psychotria, is a member of the Rubiaceae family, native to tropical regions of South America. It is a shrub characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, clustered flowers that range from white to pale yellow. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically green when immature and turn red upon ripening. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
